title: July 4th marked hottest day ever recorded globally
description: As crippling heat presses on throughout the U.S., yesterday had the hottest global average temperature ever recorded, according to preliminary data. NBC News’ Emilie Ikeda has the latest weather updates.

title: Dozens killed when bus plunges into a gulch in southern Mexico
description: MEXICO CITY — A passenger bus lost control and veered off a road and into a 75-foot-deep gully in southern Mexico on Wednesday, killing as many as 27 passengers, an official said.

title: English soccer team owner killed when Range Rover ‘lost control on bend’ in Cape Cod
description: The owner and chairman of Millwall football club died in a car crash, police have revealed.

title: South Korea includes American teenager in Women’s World Cup squad
description: South Korea includes American teenager Casey Phair as part of its 23-player squad for the Women’s World Cup.

title: Deadly floods follow torrential rain in Chongqing, China
description: At least 15 people were killed over recent days after severe flooding caused by heavy rains hit China’s Chongqing municipality.

title: Israel ends its two day military operation in the occupied West Bank
description: Israel says it has ended its two-day military operation at the Jenin refugee camp in the occupied West Bank as militants from the Gaza Strip fired rockets towards Israel. NBC News’ Matt Bradley explains whether tensions could rise further and how the international community is reacting to the increase in violent over the last two days.

title: Two months after King Charles III’s coronation, Scotland hosts its own event to honor the new monarch
description: Two months after the lavish coronation of King Charles III at Westminster Abbey in London, Scotland is set to host its own event to mark the new monarch’s accession to the throne.

title: Kyiv and Moscow trade allegations over Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant
description: Russia and Ukraine have accused each other of plotting to stage an attack on the Russian-held Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant, long the subject of mutual recriminations and suspicions.

title: King Charles III marks second coronation in Scotland
description: Two months after his coronation at Westminster Abbey in London, King Charles III and Queen Camilla are set to be crowned again in Scotland as part of a hundreds-year-old tradition. NBC News royal commentator Daisy McAndrews explains what to expect from the king’s second coronation and how people living in Scotland are reacting.

title: Prigozhin appears to call for support after rebellion against Moscow
description: A new voice message that appears to be from the leader of the Wagner mercenary group, Yevgeny Prigozhin, calling for support has been posted on Telegram just over a week after the group’s rebellion against Moscow. NBC News’ Kelly Cobiella reports from Poltava, Ukraine.

title: Biden hosts Sweden’s prime minister in a show of support for NATO bid
description: Joe Biden hosts Sweden’s prime minister at the White House as the United States presses for the Nordic nation’s entry into NATO before the alliance’s summit.

title: Israeli jets strike Gaza after militants fire rockets toward Israel
description: Israeli jets struck several sites in Gaza early Wednesday, officials said. The strikes came after militants from Hamas-ruled Gaza fired five rockets toward Israel, which the Israeli military said were intercepted.

title: World swelters under unofficial hottest day on record
description: The entire planet sweltered to the unofficial hottest day in human recordkeeping July 3, according to University of Maine scientists at the Climate Reanalyzer project.

title: Israeli troops withdraw from West Bank as Gaza rockets are fired
description: Militants from the Gaza Strip fired rockets on Wednesday after Israeli forces withdrew from the Palestinian city of Jenin, following one of their biggest military operations in the occupied West Bank for years.

title: Prominent female Russian journalist and lawyer brutally attacked in Chechnya
description: Armed masked men attacked a prominent female journalist and a lawyer in the Russian region of Chechnya after forcing their car to stop.

title: Rain kills 15 in southwest China as Xi urges better defenses
description: Torrential rain killed 15 people in southwest China, as President Xi Jinping called for greater efforts to protect the public from extreme weather.

title: Taiwan doesn’t see conflict as ‘imminent,’ but it’s preparing anyway
description: Taiwan is not expecting an attack from China anytime soon, but that doesn’t mean it isn’t preparing for one.

title: Crashed North Korea satellite had ‘no military utility,’ South Korea says
description: South Korea’s military said it had retrieved the wreckage from a crashed North Korean spy satellite and found it had no meaningful military use.
